sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Turkey's president has promised to rebuild thousands of homes in one year, while much-needed aid crosses into rebel-held northern Syria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: NATO has vowed to support Ukraine for as long as it takes, as defence ministers call for more ammunition production.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The Chinese and Iranian presidents meet in Beijing to strengthen economic ties in the face of Western sanctions.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: After a poor run of form in the Premier League, Chelsea will be looking to bounce back this evening in the Champions League.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Exhaustion in Turkey and Syria after more than a week of non-stop searching for survivors.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Following what the World Health Organization has called the worst natural disaster in 100 years.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The combined death toll following the February 6th earthquakes has passed 41,000 and is showing no signs of slowing down.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Turkish President Recep Tayyip Erdogan has been visiting some of the survivors in hospital.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: He has promised new homes to replace the thousands that have been destroyed.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: And he has vowed to build them across the 10 affected areas within a year.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's a pledge proving difficult for emergency teams to understand, as they struggle to pick through towering piles of rubble with little prospect of clearing it in sight.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But aid agencies and governments are stepping up efforts to bring help to devastated areas.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The situation in Syria is particularly desperate, where over a decade of civil wars, complicated relief efforts and political wrangling has delayed help.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: On Tuesday, an aid convoy finally passed through a reopened border crossing into rebel-held northwestern Syria.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The UN has launched a 370 million euro appeal to provide quote, life-saving relief for nearly five million Syrians for three months.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: As Russia increases its attacks in Ukraine's south and east, defending soldiers on the front lines say they urgently need more ammunition and planes to win the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: While Moscow has at times reportedly been firing a staggering 20,000 artillery shells a day.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Ukraine is supposedly firing up to a fraction of this, some 6 to 7,000.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: But at this rate, Ukraine is still using up ammunition far faster than its allies can provide it.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_04
sentences.sentence: NATO Defence Ministers currently taking part in a two-day meeting in Brussels have been urged by the military alliance chief to ramp up ammunition production but there is no decision on providing jet fighters. NATO allies are providing unprecedented support to Ukraine to help uphold its right of self-defense and from the start we have been working very closely with the European Union, determined to support Ukraine for as long as it takes.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It's widely believed Russia is planning a new offensive soon, but in the meantime, it is piling on the pressure near the village of Bakhmut.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: If it were captured, it would give Russia a significant symbolic boost ahead of the first anniversary of the war.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: of the first anniversary of the war.

sentences.sentence: A depiction of happiness which masks something far more sinister.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: These are children from Donbass and other Russian-occupied areas of Ukraine who were taken to be handed over to Russian families and given Russian nationality.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_06
sentences.sentence: President Putin's Commissioner for Children's Rights defends it as an act of love for orphaned children who have no one to take care of them. But an investigation by the EBU investigative journalism network reveals that many of these kids do have families and were taken to Russia under false pretenses or without their consent. Not only is forcible transfer a war crime, but also adopting children during time of war is also completely against international law.

sentences.sentence: Oleksandr's grandmother was able to rescue him before he was transferred.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: They have no news of what's happened to the mother.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_03
sentences.sentence: Natalia sent her daughter to a summer camp organized by Moscow-designated authorities in Kozachylopanye, one of the first Ukrainian cities to be occupied.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_08
sentences.sentence: She was able to see her daughter Karina again, but other mothers haven't been so fortunate. Ukraine says this is akin to genocide, while this human rights lawyer says it goes beyond a war crime.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_05
sentences.sentence: Well, the forcible transfer of children, as we see it it is clearly a war crime but it's also a crime against humanity because it is being carried out on a widespread and systematic level but also because it's being carried out in the context of crimes against humanity much more than a courtesy visit, Iranian President Ebrahim Raisi met in Beijing with his Chinese

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_10
sentences.sentence: counterpart Xi Jinping on Tuesday.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: This in a context of growing international tension and deteriorating relations with Western countries.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: The leaders renewed their vows of friendship and expressed a will to deepen economic ties between Iran and China.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: And both want to continue along the path initiated last September at the Samarkand summit, where Tehran submitted its application to join the Shanghai Cooperation Organization, along with China, Russia, Pakistan and India.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: Both countries are also linked by their relations with Russia, although in a very different way.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_07
sentences.sentence: While Tehran supplies weapons and drones to the Russian army, Beijing defends Ukraine's sovereignty, although it does claim to understand the reasons behind Moscow's invasion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: First cars, now trucks and buses, as Brussels targets both in its efforts to make the transport sector carbon neutral.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Under the European Commission's plans presented Tuesday, every new bus within the E.U. cities would have to be emission-free by 2030.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The lorry sector will also have to reduce its emissions, but by 90 percent by 2040, Il faut aussi tenir compte des circonstances très spécifiques liées à des conditions climatiques.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: On parle de moyens de transport qui sont très très lourds, donc qui ont besoin d'une énorme quantité d'énergie.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_01
sentences.sentence: Et vous savez très bien que dans des conditions climatiques qui sont, par exemple, le froid, very heavy, so they need a huge amount of energy. And you know very well that in climatic conditions, such as cold weather or in mountainous regions, we must have the possibility to continue at some point with thermal engines.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: The aim is part of an effort to electrify vehicles.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: Road transport currently accounts for one fifth of greenhouse gas emissions in the EU and one third of energy consumption.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_11
sentences.sentence: In the European Parliament, some MEPs are welcoming these proposals and believe that the negotiations should be easier compared to those on car emissions. C'est plus facile que ceux sur l'on a fait sur les voitures et clôturer ce texte sous cette mandature. which the European Council must now rip a stamp for approval.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Carmaker Ford is about to cut 4,000 jobs across Europe, including about 2,300 in Germany and 1,300 in the UK.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: It intends to achieve the reductions through voluntary redundancies, mostly in engineering roles and administrative jobs. The US carmaker blames losses on rising costs and a need to switch to electric vehicle production.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: However Ford is to invest 3.03 billion euros in its first lithium iron phosphate EV battery plant in the US.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Musician and entrepreneur Pharrell Williams has become designer giant Louis Vuitton's next creative director of menswear.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: The appointment fills one of fashion's most high-profile vacancies, one open since Virgil Abloh died in November 2021.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Williams is no stranger to fashion.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: In 2003, he and Japanese designer Nigo founded Billionaire Boys Club, a clothing, accessories and lifestyle brand.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_09
sentences.sentence: Louis Vuitton is the juggernaut that helps power the wider Louis Vuitton-Mauvais Hennessy luxury empire.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Chelsea will be looking to make up for their poor league form when they travel to Borussia Dortmund this evening. With only one win in eight games, the Blues' trip to Germany could prove to be very tricky. Graham Potter's men are currently 10th in the Premier League and their captain Cesar Azpilicueta knows that his team will have to show more in the final third if they want to reach the quarter-finals.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: CESAR AZPILICUETA, the best form of results lately, but it's a new competition and now it's time to prove it on the pitch.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: We have to go step by step.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_00
sentences.sentence: I think it's not worth to look really far ahead.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Dortmund, who didn't spend as much as their opponents during the winter transfer market, seem to be more solid and are currently third in the Bundesliga after having won their last six games.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: Deprived of their young star, Youssoufa Moukoko, due to an ankle injury, the Germans will still be able to rely on Sebastian Haller, who scored 11 goals in the Champions League last year with Ajax.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: The Ivorian international has recently returned to the squad after months of battling cancer.

sentences.speaker: SPEAKER_02
sentences.sentence: In the other match, club Bruges host Benfica and Scott Parker's men will have their work cut out against a confident Portuguese side that finished first in Group H ahead of PSG and Juventus.
